{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3681208,"name":"UFUK ","username":"vertex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/90db22/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T17:48:56.765Z","cooked":"

Can I mount a motor with bended sheet metal directly to the bellypan. I wanna use this for low torque application such as rollers motor with this my main goal is making the CG lower. What is the advantage and disadvantage of using bended sheet metal for motor mounting.
Also instead of using one bended part , using 2 bended part .How will it change strenght to weight ratio. Does it useable in high torque aplication . Like in these photos.

1516×315 17.3 KB

2393×317 15.9 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T17:48:56.765Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":390,"readers_count":389,"score":188.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"UFUK ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70131,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3681213,"name":"","username":"FinIce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/finice/{size}/270519_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T17:57:40.864Z","cooked":"

I think that it could work, however having another plate that supports the other end of the shaft may help the overall load not be as stressful. For high torque applications the extra shaft support is a must.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T17:57:40.864Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":369,"readers_count":368,"score":198.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amateur Historian?"},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/2","custom_user_title":"Amateur Historian?","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681222,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:08:37.431Z","cooked":"

This seems perfectly fine for low torque applications. I’d be a bit concerned with higher torque applications if its mounted directly to the bellypan, I could see the bellypan flexing and bending upwards from the force of it depending on how well the bellypan is supported in that area.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:08:37.431Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":358,"readers_count":357,"score":91.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/3","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681223,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:09:56.293Z","cooked":"

The issue is less so the shaft bending but more so the plate the motor is attached to bending. The correct way to reinforce this setup would be to bend a flange on the side and then either attach it to the bottom or weld the corner closed to make it act as one rigid part.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:09:56.293Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":117.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52870,"username":"FinIce","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/finice/{size}/270519_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681230,"name":"UFUK ","username":"vertex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/90db22/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:21:42.729Z","cooked":"

I think I will use bolts instead of welding . Because welding require good technique .

One of the reasons why i ask this question is bellypan flexing . riveting bellypan with support profile with 1in gap start to end. Will be enough ?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:31:20.155Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":59.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"UFUK ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51417,"username":"CuteRedpandas","name":"Jared Van Horn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70131,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681233,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:33:06.151Z","cooked":"

For low-torque applications I would think it’s definitely feasible, but it wouldn’t be my first choice personally. I try to use box tubing for this kind of application where possible due to the extra rigidity it offers, even if that means cutting pockets for chains/belts/gears to pass through it.

That said, this is definitely not the worst solution I’ve ever seen either, especially the double-stacked picture you have there, but we would need more information to know for sure (such as the type of load and the direction of the load relative to the mounting bracket)

vertex:

One of the reasons why i ask this question is bellypan flexing . riveting bellypan with support profile with 1in gap start to end. Will be enough ?

How thick of a bellypan are we talking and what material? Does the bellypan have any additional bracing besides the perimeter of the frame (typically we will put additional framing across our chassis to stiffen it and mount things to)?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:38:42.886Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":70.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681246,"name":"UFUK ","username":"vertex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/90db22/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:49:43.100Z","cooked":"

Thank you for your answer. Bellypan 3mm aliminium and just 4 frame tubes and 2 support tubes . Totaly its 6 aliminium tube on the chassis

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:50:03.524Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"UFUK ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70131,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681491,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-15T02:12:43.625Z","cooked":"

Yeah, for 3mm aluminum plus the two supports, you should be fine for low-load applications mounted directly to the pan, you probably won’t get a lot of flex (we use 1/16"/1.5mm aluminum for our pan and even that is pretty ridged when well supported). If possible, I would personally try to brace it against another point of contact (like the frame/support tubes) using a gusset or something to support it, but you might be ok without it.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-15T02:12:43.625Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":84.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70131,"username":"vertex","name":"UFUK ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/90db22/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681709,"name":"","username":"Kevin_Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-15T15:18:58.358Z","cooked":"

For our climber gearbox mounting this year (VERY high forces), we ended up mounting it to the bellypan and to a gusset coming off of some poorly supported 2x1 - shown here circled in green.

image824×599 83.6 KB

I believe the gearbox & bellypan portion were fine the whole season (@credard correct me if I’m wrong), however the gusset supporting our climber uprights (circled in orange) got absolutely mangled)

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-15T15:18:58.358Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":77.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681851,"name":"Chris Redard","username":"credard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/credard/{size}/253773_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-15T19:21:40.984Z","cooked":"
Kevin_Leonard:

I believe the gearbox & bellypan portion were fine the whole season

We had some bending in the bellypan from previous iterations of the gearbox (like the version shown above in Kevin’s post, but the revision of the climber we ran all of NEDCMP and Champs solved our issues.

image958×713 163 KB

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-07-15T19:21:40.984Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":79.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504250,"topic_slug":"is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan","display_username":"Chris Redard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51893,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 3467 Mentah"},"post_url":"/t/is-it-resonable-to-mount-a-motor-with-bended-sheet-metal-directly-to-the-bellypan/504250/11","custom_user_title":"Team 3467 Mentah","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681879,"name":"Josh","username":"AegisNova","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aegisnova/{size}/265035_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-15T20:27:52.354Z","cooked":"

I don’t think it’s unreasonable. Though typically if you use any type of hex shaft/some shaft for, anything, you’ll have some sort of gearbox housing that has mounting holes. I’d be more worried about the sheet metal wobbling back and forth until it eventually snaps. But, all in all, it should be fine, especially for a low-torque “roller” application. And, if you’re worried about bending your bellypan, you could always top-up with an extra scab plate under your mounts.
